climbs.name: Wicked Sensation
climbs.fa: Tony Horness, Tony Lusk, George Lynch 2009

content.description: Crux is at the 4th bolt on the overhang. Fun climb with some technical moves. One of the better climbs at the area and will get your attention!
content.location: 3rd route from the left side.  Goes straight up to the obvious overhanging roof

content.description: Sustained climb that stays to the grade most of the way.  Lots of fun. One of the better climbs at the area.  TL really liked this climb.
content.location: 4th route from the left next to Wicked Sensation

content.description: Face climbing in the shade.  The route is considerably harder if you veer right to the ledge above the 3rd bolt.
Fun climb in the shade most of the day.  The route has some fun overhanging moves.
content.location: 1st route on the right side when you arrive at the wall

content.description: Shares start with Inspiration and is similar climbing.  The traverse move makes it a little bit harder than Inspiration.
content.location: Shares start with Inspiration - diverges right above the Inspirations 2nd bolt

content.description: Sustained climb to a roof just below the chains.  The crux is at the roof.
content.location: 5th route from the left side.  Just right of Summers Haven

content.description: Crux at the start to easy climbing then a fun vertical face to the chains. The belayer loses sight of the climber in the middle section of the climb. Wish the vertical face was longer!
content.location: 5th Route from the right.  This is the right side route one of the two routes in the middle of the wall

content.description: Vertical start to easy climbing and then a vertical crux below the chains.  The belayer loses sight of the climber in the middle section of the climb.
content.location: To the right of GM and on the wall in the middle of the crag.

climbs.name: Meagan's First FA
climbs.fa: Meagan Suedkamp, Tony Lusk, Tony Horness 2009

content.description: Low angle climb to fun moves pulling out of a shallow roof at the top.  Meagan loved leading it for the FA!
content.location: 7th route from the left just before the obvious black stain

content.description: One of the better climbs at the area.  Fun climb on right side of the large crack.  Sustained arête climbing.  The Separation Variation climb shares bolts with it and veers off to the right above the second bolt
content.protection: 6 or 7 bolts to quick lower anchors.
content.location: 4th route from the right.  Starts in the large crack on the right side of the middle of the crag.  Route follows the obvious arête.

climbs.name: In Tony's Likeness
climbs.fa: Ryan Suedkamp, Tony Lusk, Tony Horness 2011

content.description: Ryan Suedkamp onsighted it for the FA and named it as an homage to Tony Lusk.  Tony Lusk put the route up on lead.  Crux is close to the top
content.location: Only route on the free standing west side pinnacle.

content.description: Fondly named for the crux that has some unnamed climbers groveling to get the clip above the ledge!!

climbs.name: GM (Government Motors)
climbs.fa: Tony Horness, Tony Lusk, Mary Barra 2009

content.description: Bolts, gear and chains.  Vertical start with bolts with easy gear in middle section finishing with bolts and chains. This route pays homage to the government bailout of GM!!
content.protection: BGC it is a mixed route
content.location: Route on the right side of the Black Stain

content.description: Easy start to a flake then step down across the "divide" next to the tree to the wall.
content.location: 2nd route from the left on main wall to the right of Call Me the Breeze.

climbs.name: Cozzetti Steps Out
climbs.fa: Tony Horness, Tony Lusk, Dennis Cozzetti

content.description: Crux is at the 2nd bolt to a crack between large boulders.  Dennis would have gotten the FA if rotator cuff surgery wouldn't have sidelined him!  Many thanks to Dennis for his help at the area.
content.location: 3rd route from the right side of the upper part of the crag

climbs.name: Call Me the Breeze
climbs.fa: Tony Horness, Tony Lusk, Gary Rossington 2009

content.description: Easy start to overhanging flake.  The flake has a nice move with some exposure.
content.location: Furthest route on the left side of the west side of the wall.  This is the first route to the right of drainage between the pinnacle and west side of the wall.

content.description: Climb black stain to well featured finish.  Well protected climb that is a good beginning lead.
content.location: 8th route from the left and climbs into the obvious black stain

content.description:
Moderate sport crag with 17 climbs from 5.6 to 5.11.  Tony Lusk found the crag and developed it with Tony Horness.  The rock is good quality in a heavily wooded area with a short approach. 

  The main wall is split up into 3 sections.  The first part of the climbing area on the east side has 5 climbs.  The middle section of the wall has two climbs that start vertically and then are low angle which makes it hard for the belayer to see the climber.  The west side of the crag has a 10 climbs with the first climb on a stand alone pinnacle.
